segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And my name is Katherine.
And today at EnglishPod, we have a lesson for you about small talk.
segments.cn: 今天在EnglishPod，我们有一节关于闲聊的课程。

segments.en: That's right.
We continue with our series about short, casual conversations you may have with your friends, somebody you haven't seen in a long time, or maybe even a co-worker.
segments.cn: 我们继续我们的系列，讨论你可能和朋友、很久没见的人，或者甚至同事进行的简短、随意的对话。

segments.en: That's right.
So in today's dialogue, we're going to listen to two people who work in the same building.
segments.cn: 所以在今天的对话中，我们将听到两位在同一栋楼工作的人。

segments.en: They're going to talk a little bit about travel, right, Marco?
Yep, we're going to talk a little bit about recommending a place to go on vacation, maybe Europe.
segments.cn: 是的，我们会聊聊推荐一个度假去的地方，也许是欧洲。

segments.en: And so we're going to have some great phrases as to speaking of this topic very briefly with a friend.
segments.cn: 所以我们将有一些很好的短语，来简要地与朋友谈论这个话题。

segments.en: All right, let's listen to today's dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们来听今天的对话。

segments.en: Hey, Michelle, good to see you.
Are you at lunch?
Oh, hi, Jim.
No, I just got back.
I thought you were on vacation now.
segments.cn: 我以为你现在在度假呢。

segments.en: No, I wish I was.
I just got back from Spain, actually.
segments.cn: 其实我刚从西班牙回来。

segments.en: Oh, wonderful.
Have you been there before?
Or was it your first time?
My first time.
I've traveled around Europe a lot, but this was my first time to Spain.
segments.cn: 我在欧洲旅行过很多，但这是我第一次去西班牙。

segments.en: It was amazing.
And the weather was just beautiful.
No rain and just sun, sun, sun.
segments.cn: 没有雨，只有阳光，阳光，阳光。

segments.en: I'm so jealous of you.
I've never been anywhere in Europe.
segments.cn: 我从未去过欧洲的任何地方。

segments.en: I've always dreamed of traveling around and seeing the sights.
segments.cn: 我一直梦想着环游并欣赏风景。

segments.en: Well, I really recommend Spain.
segments.cn: 好吧，我真的推荐西班牙。

segments.en: You really should go.
Anyway, it's been great to catch up, but I must be going.
segments.cn: 不过，聊得很愉快，但我得走了。

segments.en: This is my floor.
Speak again soon, I hope.
For sure.
Take care.
All right, we're back.
So now let's take a look at some of the language on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看Language Takeaway中的一些语言。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
All right, in Language Takeaway, we've got a couple of words and phrases for you.
segments.cn: 好的，在Language Takeaway中，我们为你准备了一些单词和短语。

segments.en: The first one is, I just got back.
So to get back from somewhere, Marco.
That's right, Jim.
Just got back from Europe.
And when you say, I just got back, is I recently or very recently returned from somewhere.
segments.cn: 当你说，我刚回来时，是指我最近或非常最近从某个地方返回。

segments.en: That's right.
To get back from somewhere means to return from that place.
segments.cn: 从某个地方回来意味着从那个地方返回。

segments.en: So in this dialogue, Jim just got back from Spain.
segments.cn: 所以在这个对话中，Jim刚从西班牙回来。

segments.en: Michelle just got back from lunch.
This means to return from somewhere.
segments.cn: 这意味着从某个地方返回。

segments.en: That's right.
So it can be a place, not only a country, but it can be, for example, the office.
segments.cn: 所以它可以是一个地方，不仅仅是一个国家，比如办公室。

segments.en: I just got back from work.
Or I just got back from football practice.
segments.cn: 或者我刚从足球训练回来。

segments.en: That's why I'm very sweaty.
Right.
So this obviously means that you are now not in the same place where you just got back from.
segments.cn: 所以这显然意味着你现在不在你刚刚回来过的地方。

segments.en: Now I'm from America.
I went to Spain on vacation and I just got back from Spain.
segments.cn: 我去西班牙度假，刚从西班牙回来。

segments.en: That means I'm in America again.
segments.cn: 这意味着我又在美国了。

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
You're not still in Spain.
No.
All right.
So that's for our first word.
segments.cn: 所以这是我们的第一个单词。

segments.en: Now let's go on.
And Michelle said, Oh, I'm so jealous of you.
All right.
Jealous is an adjective and a very, very common one.
segments.cn: 羡慕是一个形容词，非常常见。

segments.en: You can use it in many different circumstances.
segments.cn: 你可以在许多不同的情况下使用它。

segments.en: It means to want what someone else has.
segments.cn: 它意味着想要别人拥有的东西。

segments.en: That's right.
So in this case, Michelle is jealous that Jim went on vacation.
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下，Michelle羡慕Jim去度假。

segments.en: So she wishes she could go on vacation.
segments.cn: 所以她希望自己也能去度假。

segments.en: That's right.
I'm so jealous of you.
Or if you see someone who has a new pair of shoes and you like the shoes because you don't have them, you can say, I'm so jealous.
segments.cn: 或者如果你看到某人有一双新鞋，而你喜欢那双鞋因为你没有，你可以说，我真羡慕。

segments.en: I love your shoes.
That's right.
So you say, I am jealous.
Or if you are jealous of a person, you say, I am jealous of you.
segments.cn: 或者如果你羡慕一个人，你可以说，我羡慕你。

segments.en: And so they were ending their conversation and Jim said, You know what?
segments.cn: 然后他们结束了对话，Jim说，你知道吗？

segments.en: It's been great to catch up with you.
All right.
This is a really important phrase to catch up.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常重要的短语，catch up。

segments.en: It means two different things.
And we're going to talk about one meaning here today.
segments.cn: 今天我们将讨论其中一个意思。

segments.en: To catch up with someone, like to talk to them about what they've been doing recently means to learn about their life because maybe you haven't talked in a long time.
segments.cn: 和某人catch up，像是和他们谈谈他们最近在做什么，意味着了解他们的生活，因为你可能很久没聊过。

segments.en: That's right.
So maybe you haven't seen your friend in two years and you go out for dinner to catch up, to talk about what has happened in your life recently.
segments.cn: 所以也许你两年没见你的朋友了，你们出去吃晚餐以catch up，谈谈你最近生活中发生的事情。

segments.en: That's right.
Or if you see a friend on the street and you know that you haven't seen him or her in a long time, you can make a date to catch up.
segments.cn: 或者如果你在街上看到一个朋友，你知道你很久没见他或她了，你可以约个时间catch up。

segments.en: So, Hey, Marco, I haven't seen you in months.
segments.cn: 所以，嘿，Marco，我几个月没见你了。

segments.en: Let's catch up sometime soon.
That's right.
And that means to share information and to find out how you have been recently.
segments.cn: 这意味着分享信息，了解你最近过得怎么样。

segments.en: Exactly.
All right.
Now, when he was getting out of the elevator, he said, this is my floor.
segments.cn: 现在，当他走出电梯时，他说，这是我的楼层。

segments.en: Now we know floor, but my floor, what is it?
segments.cn: 现在我们知道楼层，但我的楼层是什么？

segments.en: My floor?
Your floor?
Whose floor?
This doesn't make much sense, does it?
Well, actually floor here means that this is the floor that I work on or the floor that I live on.
segments.cn: 实际上，这里的楼层是指我工作的楼层或我居住的楼层。

segments.en: It means the place I'm going to.
segments.cn: 这意味着我要去的地方。

segments.en: Right.
So we know floor, the ground beneath our feet in a building.
segments.cn: 所以我们知道楼层，就是建筑物下方的地面。

segments.en: But in this case, we're talking about one of the levels of a building.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，我们谈论的是建筑物的某一层。

segments.en: So maybe the sixth floor.
That's right.
So if I'm in my apartment building in the elevator, I can say, Oh, stop the elevator.
segments.cn: 所以如果我在公寓楼的电梯里，我可以说，哦，停下电梯。

segments.en: This is my floor.
I want to get off the elevator, right?
This is where this is where I live.
All right.
So a lot of great stuff there.
segments.cn: 所以这里有很多好东西。

segments.en: Why don't we take a break and listen to the dialogue again?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不休息一下，再听一遍对话呢？

segments.en: Hey, Michelle.
Good to see you.
Are you at lunch?
Oh, hi, Jim.
No, I just got back.
I thought you were on vacation now.
segments.cn: 我以为你现在在度假呢。

segments.en: No, I wish I was.
I just got back from Spain, actually.
segments.cn: 其实我刚从西班牙回来。

segments.en: Oh, wonderful.
Have you been there before?
Or was it your first time?
My first time.
I've traveled around Europe a lot, but this is my first time to Spain.
segments.cn: 我在欧洲旅行过很多，但这是我第一次去西班牙。

segments.en: It was amazing.
And the weather was just beautiful.
No rain and just sun, sun, sun.
segments.cn: 没有雨，只有阳光，阳光，阳光。

segments.en: I'm so jealous of you.
I've never been anywhere in Europe.
segments.cn: 我从未去过欧洲的任何地方。

segments.en: I've always dreamed of traveling around and seeing the sites.
segments.cn: 我一直梦想着四处旅行，看看风景。

segments.en: Well, I really recommend Spain.
segments.cn: 好吧，我真的推荐西班牙。

segments.en: You really should go.
Anyway, it's been great to catch up, but I must be going.
segments.cn: 不管怎样，见面真好，但我得走了。

segments.en: This is my floor.
Speak again soon, I hope.
For sure.
Take care.
All right, we're back.
So now let's take a look at four key phrases on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看流利构建器上的四个关键短语。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
So there are some keys to these small talk conversations, and they are definitely the phrases.
segments.cn: 所以这些闲聊对话有一些关键点，确实是短语。

segments.en: The first one we have here is good to see you.
segments.cn: 我们这里的第一个是很高兴见到你。

segments.en: So Jim says, Hey, Michelle, good to see you.
segments.cn: 所以吉姆说，嘿，米歇尔，很高兴见到你。

segments.en: That's right.
So we've chosen this phrase because it's very casual and very common to use as a polite way of saying, Hey, how are you?
segments.cn: 我们选择这个短语是因为它非常随意，并且作为礼貌的问候方式非常常用，嘿，你好吗？

segments.en: Good to see you.
I'm actually showing you that I'm happy that I am talking to you.
segments.cn: 我实际上是在告诉你，我很高兴和你交谈。

segments.en: So this is a very flexible phrase.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个非常灵活的短语。

segments.en: You can say it at the beginning of a conversation when you just see someone.
segments.cn: 你可以在对话开始时说，当你刚见到某人时。

segments.en: Hey, Marco, good to see you.
segments.cn: 嘿，马尔科，很高兴见到你。

segments.en: Or at the end, you can say, It was very good to see you.
segments.cn: 或者在结束时，你可以说，很高兴见到你。

segments.en: I hope to see you again soon.
That's right.
So maybe you can use it at the beginning.
segments.cn: 所以也许你可以在开始时使用它。

segments.en: If you just begin to talk to someone or if you're saying goodbye, you can say, Well, you know what?
segments.cn: 如果你刚开始和某人交谈，或者如果你在说再见时，你可以说，嗯，你知道吗？

segments.en: I have to go now, but it's been good to see you.
segments.cn: 我现在得走了，但很高兴见到你。

segments.en: So very flexible phrase.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个非常灵活的短语。

segments.en: That's right.
That's right.
Now, when Michelle thought that Jim was on vacation, Jim said, No, no, no, I wish I was.
segments.cn: 现在，当米歇尔认为吉姆在度假时，吉姆说，不，不，我希望我在。

segments.en: All right.
I wish I was.
I thought you were on vacation.
So she thought that he was still on vacation in Spain.
segments.cn: 所以她认为他还在西班牙度假。

segments.en: And he says, Well, I'm not because, you know, here I am.
segments.cn: 他则说，嗯，我不是，因为你知道，我在这里。

segments.en: But I wish I was.
I wish I was in Spain right now because Spain is so nice.
segments.cn: 我希望我现在在西班牙，因为西班牙太好了。

segments.en: That's right.
So it may seem a little bit strange, but it's actually completing the idea.
segments.cn: 所以这可能看起来有点奇怪，但实际上是在完成这个想法。

segments.en: So and basically we're using the verb to be because that's the question.
segments.cn: 基本上我们在使用动词“是”，因为这是问题。

segments.en: Are you on vacation?
No, I wish I was on vacation.
So that means he's not, but he wants to be.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着他没有，但他想要。

segments.en: That's right.
Okay.
So now he actually had to get going.
segments.cn: 所以现在他实际上得走了。

segments.en: And he used this exact phrase.
segments.cn: 他使用了这个确切的短语。

segments.en: He said, I must be going.
I must be going.
Now remember this as a phrase.
This is a good way to end a conversation.
segments.cn: 这是结束对话的好方法。

segments.en: Maybe you have to go to work.
Maybe you have your kids at home.
You have to take them somewhere.
segments.cn: 你得带他们去某个地方。

segments.en: So you say, I'm really sorry.
segments.cn: 所以你说，我真的很抱歉。

segments.en: I must be going, but let's see each other again soon.
segments.cn: 我得走了，但希望我们很快再见。

segments.en: That's right.
So you are politely ending the conversation.
segments.cn: 所以你是在礼貌地结束对话。

segments.en: You are politely saying, I can't talk to you anymore.
segments.cn: 你在礼貌地说，我不能再和你交谈了。

segments.en: I must be going now, but it's been great to talk to you.
segments.cn: 我现在得走了，但和你交谈真好。

segments.en: That's right.
Very polite.
So remember this one, it's better than I'm going now.
segments.cn: 所以记住这一点，比我现在得走要好。

segments.en: Right.
Or I have to go.
Well, you can say I have to go, but it's nice saying, Oh, you know what?
segments.cn: 嗯，你可以说我得走了，但说“哦，你知道吗？”更好。

segments.en: Uh, I really like talking to you, but I must be going.
segments.cn: 嗯，我真的很喜欢和你聊天，但我得走了。

segments.en: And Jim also finished by saying, we will speak again soon.
segments.cn: 吉姆也结束时说，我们很快会再聊。

segments.en: And Michelle said, for sure.
For sure.
Now Americans particularly love to say this phrase for sure means yes, or I agree or definitely.
segments.cn: 现在美国人特别喜欢说这个短语“当然”意味着“是的”或“我同意”或“绝对”。

segments.en: Right.
Let's you can use it as an interjection.
segments.cn: 你可以把它用作感叹词。

segments.en: So, if I say, Hey Catherine, am I going to see you later on today?
segments.cn: 所以，如果我说，嘿凯瑟琳，我今天晚些时候会见到你吗？

segments.en: Yeah, for sure.
For sure.
There we go.
So you're saying yes, absolutely.
Definitely.
For sure.
So Marco, my birthday is Friday night.
segments.cn: 所以马尔科，我的生日是星期五晚上。

segments.en: Are you going to come to the party?
Oh, for sure.
I wouldn't miss it for the world.
All right.
So that's all we have for today.
Why don't we review everything we've taken a look at now and listen to the dialogue.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不回顾一下我们现在所看过的内容，并听听对话。

segments.en: Hey, Michelle.
Good to see you.
Are you at lunch?
Oh, hi, Jim.
No, I just got back.
I thought you were on vacation now.
segments.cn: 我以为你现在在度假呢。

segments.en: No, I wish I was.
I just got back from Spain actually.
segments.cn: 我实际上刚从西班牙回来。

segments.en: Oh, wonderful.
Have you been there before or was it your first time?
segments.cn: 你以前去过那里吗，还是第一次？

segments.en: My first time.
I've traveled around Europe a lot, but this was my first time to Spain.
segments.cn: 我在欧洲旅行过很多，但这是我第一次去西班牙。

segments.en: It was amazing.
And the weather was just beautiful.
No rain and just sun, sun, sun.
segments.cn: 没有雨，只有阳光，阳光，阳光。

segments.en: I'm so jealous of you.
I've never been anywhere in Europe.
segments.cn: 我从未去过欧洲的任何地方。

segments.en: I've always dreamed of traveling around and seeing the sights.
segments.cn: 我一直梦想着四处旅行，看看风景。

segments.en: Well, I really recommend Spain.
You really should go.
Anyway, it's been great to catch up, but I must be going.
segments.cn: 不管怎样，聊得很愉快，但我得走了。

segments.en: This is my floor.
Speak again soon, I hope.
For sure.
Take care.
All right.
So this was another part of our small talk series.
segments.cn: 所以这是我们闲聊系列的另一部分。

segments.en: As you can see, very short, but very useful language used to talk very briefly with someone.
segments.cn: 如你所见，非常简短，但非常有用的语言，用于与某人简短交谈。

segments.en: It always happens.
You meet somebody at the elevator or you just want to talk very quickly.
segments.cn: 你在电梯里遇到某人，或者你只是想快速聊天。

segments.en: Yeah, but you don't want to talk about anything that's too personal, like someone's politics or their religious beliefs or their children, because maybe you don't know them very well.
segments.cn: 是的，但你不想谈论任何过于个人的事情，比如某人的政治或宗教信仰或他们的孩子，因为你可能不太了解他们。

segments.en: So these are really great topics to talk about, like business trips or vacation or the weather.
segments.cn: 所以这些话题真的很好，比如商务旅行、假期或天气。

segments.en: English speakers love to talk about these when they don't know someone that well.
segments.cn: 英语使用者喜欢在不太了解某人的情况下谈论这些。

segments.en: That's right.
That's right.
So if you have any questions or any comments about this lesson or you want to suggest any other topics, you can find us at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 所以如果你对这节课有任何问题或评论，或者想建议其他话题，可以在EnglishPod.com找到我们。

segments.en: We hope to see you all there.
segments.cn: 我们希望在那里见到你们。

segments.en: Bye.
See you guys.
Bye.
